channel.title: Planning on starting a new account
channel.description: Ok im planning on starting a new account and botting my way through it to see how it goes, but I've never botted before, never looked into it or anything like that so my question is, whats the best bot/bots to use (for a variety of purposes)? where do i start? any tips for what to bot to make a bit of cash to start with? and is there anything I should know before I start it?

item.title: Planning on starting a new account
item.dc:creator: @error.login cane
item.description:
@error.login wrote:

Yeah I was running 3 accounts on different worlds, and in 1 or 2 days it funded 99 firemaking with quite a bit left over. When I was doing this it was around 90gp each? But it was rising in price and sold instantly which was rather nice.

Read full topic
item.source: Planning on starting a new account

item.title: Planning on starting a new account
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

cane:

Well if your account was f2p then flax would be out of the question. Plus if you login to a world with 1.5k+ players online there will be at leased 1 person burning logs at the grand exchange, then you just collect the ash from those players That’s what I did.

aha

Fair enough, I’m sure it would also build up if you did it on multiple accounts over loads of worlds. I guess I’ll give it a try sometime if I play again. Do you know what price ash sells for in the GE?

I think this could also be used to cover the costs of firemaking, depending on which logs you’re using.

Read full topic
item.source: Planning on starting a new account

item.title: Planning on starting a new account
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

[quote=“cane, post:8, topic:391803”][quote author=bootnecklad link=topic=488969.msg3575798#msg3575798 date=1303415717]
So I’m using RSBuddy to setup 40+ accounts mining essence…

Time to work out how much GPs ill get a day from botting mules.
[/quote]
I found collecting ash can be quite profitable (around 80-100k per hour), and no stats are required.[/quote]

Wouldn’t picking flax be an easier alternative?

Ash

RuneScape

Ashes - Grand Exchange - RuneScape

A heap of ashes.

Flax

RuneScape

Flax - Grand Exchange - RuneScape

I should use this with a spinning wheel.

I don’t know the buying price of flax to date, but I’m guessing flax would be faster? Unless you’re looking to train fire making with cheap logs and then collect the ash to create a potential profit. Instead of firemaking, Cane, what other methods would be possible for collecting ash which would be efficient enough to make a good profit?

I’ve never really seen this method put into action.

Read full topic
item.source: Planning on starting a new account

If you are willing to pay, RsBotting have the best scripts for a variety of skills, but not all. I would recommend checking them out.

item.source: Planning on starting a new account

item.title: Planning on starting a new account
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

[quote=“bootnecklad, post:3, topic:391803”][quote author=Tom_BETA link=topic=488969.msg3574718#msg3574718 date=1303334083]
snip
[/quote]
Nice alternatives if someone doesn’t want to use premium bots!

@Sanga I just finished ~2hours of power mining using RSbuddy. It seems all right actually.[/quote]

Rsbuddy actually looks alright, I like the search function for the scripts instead of having to manually look for them. I’m yet to actually test the scripts out for a long period of time but I’ll probably post if anything goes dramatically wrong anyway.

@sanga If you don’t want to use anything I said in my post then just take a look @ https://scripts.rsbuddy.com But the botting tips 101 would still be something good to read.

I’m sure rsbots/rsbuddy are both good but I suppose it depends on what you flavour most.

[quote=“Tom_BETA, post:2, topic:391803”]Good reads:
http://www.rsbots.net/manuals/Botting-Tips-101/
http://www.rsbots.net/blog/

The blog actually provides good in depth reviews of bots released for Runescape, I always like to take a read before purchasing anything. It has some really good article writers which covers the pros/cons of each bot. In addition to the Botting tips 101 I’d like to add my own personal preferences that you should make your name as complicated as possible so it is more difficult for people to report you.

Based on past experience I recommend you baby sit your bot until your comfortable that the setting you’ve set are working in the environment you’ve chosen. You could also just read this

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

And adapt your bots to suit specific methods in the thread, there really is no limit to the configuration you can give your bots. I’ve also put together a list of things I’ve found not to do when botting.

Do not

[ul][li]Set the random break timers to silly amounts over long periods of time, not only does this look suspicious but it also has a pretty big chance of messing the bot up anyhow.[/li][/ul]

[ul][li]Report another player, there is a fair chance Jagex will review your account as well as the person you’ve reported so I wouldn’t risk it.[/li][/ul]

I’ve simply threw this post together but I get of the bed, but I’ve tried to include as much detail as is needed, I’ll probably update it in the morning.[/quote]

The reviews for Rsbuddy seem up to scratch also.

Read full topic

item.source: Planning on starting a new account

item.title: Planning on starting a new account
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

If you’re looking to start completely fresh then you obviously need to take into account what direction you want your account to go in and what you hope to achieve by the end. My usual plan is to create as much GP as possible and then go onto training my stats.

I’ve always used Auto flaxpicker and Auto snape grass to make money on low level accounts, though if you’re using a higher more experienced account you can go for more combat based bots such as auto GDK. On the skills side of things if you want to produce money while advancing in skills then you should probably look into using auto woodcutter on yew trees.

Bots for low levels: (money)

[ul][li]http://www.rsbots.net/bots/AutoFlaxer-Pro/[/li][li]http://www.rsbots.net/bots/AutoSnapeGrass-Pro/[/li][li]http://www.rsbots.net/bots/AutoTanner-Pro/[/li][/ul]

Bots for higher levels: (money)

[ul][li]http://www.rsbots.net/bots/AutoAviansies-Pro/[/li][li]http://www.rsbots.net/bots/AutoZombies-Pro/[/li][li]http://www.rsbots.net/bots/AutoGDK-Pro/[/li][li]http://www.rsbots.net/bots/AutoBDK-Pro/[/li][/ul]

Bots for combat:

[ul][li]http://www.rsbots.net/bots/AutoAviansies-Pro/[/li][li]http://www.rsbots.net/bots/AutoZombies-Pro/[/li][li]http://www.rsbots.net/bots/AutoGDK-Pro/[/li][li]http://www.rsbots.net/bots/AutoBDK-Pro/[/li][li]http://www.rsbots.net/bots/AutoPestControl-Pro/[/li][/ul]

I just went over the list to give a brief summary of whats available, I actually have a ton of Auth codes which are from when I played runescape, if you want to use any just say so, it’s not like I have a use for them anymore.

Good reads:
http://www.rsbots.net/manuals/Botting-Tips-101/
http://www.rsbots.net/blog/

The blog actually provides good in depth reviews of bots released for Runescape, I always like to take a read before purchasing anything. It has some really good article writers which covers the pros/cons of each bot. In addition to the Botting tips 101 I’d like to add my own personal preferences that you should make your name as complicated as possible so it is more difficult for people to report you.

Based on past experience I recommend you baby sit your bot until your comfortable that the setting you’ve set are working in the environment you’ve chosen. You could also just read this

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

And adapt your bots to suit specific methods in the thread, there really is no limit to the configuration you can give your bots. I’ve also put together a list of things I’ve found not to do when botting.

Do not

[ul][li]Set the random break timers to silly amounts over long periods of time, not only does this look suspicious but it also has a pretty big chance of messing the bot up anyhow.[/li][/ul]

[ul][li]Report another player, there is a fair chance Jagex will review your account as well as the person you’ve reported so I wouldn’t risk it.[/li][/ul]

I’ve simply threw this post together but I get of the bed, but I’ve tried to include as much detail as is needed, I’ll probably update it in the morning.

[hr]

And then onto the topic of free bots, Rsbuddy.

Any script:

https://scripts.rsbuddy.com

Read full topic
